headline: Heard on the Street Recap: Memory Boost
summary: The report, which was released later than normal because of the shutdown, said that consumer prices rose 2.7% in November from a year earlier.  Micron led the S&P 500 with a 10% jump for the day, while Sandisk and chip equipment maker Lam Research were the other top gainers on the index by the close.

content.title: Heard on the Street Recap: Memory Boost
content.summary: The report, which was released later than normal because of the shutdown, said that consumer prices rose 2.7% in November from a year earlier.  Micron led the S&P 500 with a 10% jump for the day, while Sandisk and chip equipment maker Lam Research were the other top gainers on the index by the close.

headline: Why 2026 May Be Apple’s Year
summary: One of the most important stocks in the market, and still one of the most valuable companies in the world, Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) is a company I’d argue investors can’t ignore. Indeed, given the company’s market capitalization of more than $4 trillion, the directional moves Apple makes over any time frame will likely impact most investors, whether they ... headline: Amazon, Apple, Google, etc.: Why the Mag 7 needs to 'recalibrate'
summary: The S&P 500 (^GSPC) is concentrated primarily in the top ten technology stocks, according to Barclays. PNC Asset Management Group chief investment officer Amanda Agati, Yahoo Finance Senior Business Reporter Ines Ferré, and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma join Opening Bid host Brian Sozzi to discuss the market's concentration in tech and whether it's time for investors to start selling the "Magnificent Seven." To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

content.title: Amazon, Apple, Google, etc.: Why the Mag 7 needs to 'recalibrate'
content.description:
The S&P 500 (^GSPC) is concentrated primarily in the top ten technology stocks, according to Barclays.

PNC Asset Management Group chief investment officer Amanda Agati, Yahoo Finance Senior Business Reporter Ines Ferré, and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma join Opening Bid host Brian Sozzi to discuss the market's concentration in tech and whether it's time for investors to start selling the "Magnificent Seven."

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Apple announces changes to iOS in Japan
summary: CUPERTINO, Calif., December 18, 2025--Apple® today announced changes impacting iOS apps in Japan to comply with the Mobile Software Competition Act (MSCA). These updates create new options for developers to distribute apps on alternative app marketplaces and to process app payments for digital goods and services outside of Apple In-App Purchase. Across these changes, Apple has worked to reduce new privacy and security risks the law creates to provide users in Japan the best and safest experience

content.title: Apple announces changes to iOS in Japan
content.summary: CUPERTINO, Calif., December 18, 2025--Apple® today announced changes impacting iOS apps in Japan to comply with the Mobile Software Competition Act (MSCA). These updates create new options for developers to distribute apps on alternative app marketplaces and to process app payments for digital goods and services outside of Apple In-App Purchase. Across these changes, Apple has worked to reduce new privacy and security risks the law creates to provide users in Japan the best and safest experience
